abstract: Brocade claims its post-merger integration with former rival McData is well under way. The analyst firm The 451 Group looks at whether the bulked-up storage-area network vendor can hold off Cisco Systems as it attempts to broaden its product base. The report concludes that Brocade, which has a market capitalization of about $4 billion, “will make further acquisitions in the Ethernet market to ensure it can be competitive with Cisco in this space.”
lead_paragraph: Brocade claims its post-merger integration with former rival McData is well under way. The analyst firm The 451 Group looks at whether the bulked-up storage-area network vendor can hold off Cisco Systems as it attempts to broaden its product base. The report concludes that Brocade, which has a market capitalization of about $4 billion, “will make further acquisitions in the Ethernet market to ensure it can be competitive with Cisco in this space.”
